lexa.core.data.io

Class DataWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexa.core.data.io.DataWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, WriteDataSet

    public class DataWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements WriteDataSet
    Write DataItem and DataSet objects to an output stream.

    A lexa.core.data.DataSet is written as a series of lexa.core.data.DataItem objects.

    A lexa.core.data.DataItem is written as the name followed by the formatted value; with the toString depends on the data type.

    The toString of the output is: 

     # comments can be added at any point and each
 # item is written thus:
 # name t value
 example {
 # Boolean -
    isMale ? true
 # SimpleDataSet -
 ` *    subBlock {
       item - simple text.
    }
 # Date -
    dateWriten @ 2013-02-27 12:00:25.3789Z
 # Double -
    weight $ 75.3
 # Integer -
    age % 42
 # String [without reserved characters] -
    name - William Norman-Walker
 # String [with reserved chracters] -
    longText \
 \# this will all be read as\
 it \@ contains all the special chracters \\ escaped\
 \{ so the parser can read them \}.\
 all for \$15.00 \@ \-50\% discount
 }
 # String [quote delimited]
    quotedText "
      The writer will not produce this output,
      but data files created externally can use this.
      To include a quote use "" and this toString allows

      blank lines too.
      NB Indentation and new lines are preserved.
    "

 # [example ended]
    Since:
    2013-02
    Author:
    William

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the output.

        Once the output has been closed, no more data may be written.

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs closing the output.

      • comment

        public void comment(java.lang.String comment)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Write a comment to the output.

        Comments are written to the output prefixing each line with the # character. When read back using a DataReader comments are ignored.

        Parameters:
        comment - The comment to be written to the output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs writing to the output.

      • write

        public void write(DataSet data)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Write a DataSet to the file.

        Each DataSet is written to the output using write(lexa.core.data.DataItem).

        Specified by:
        write in interface WriteDataSet
        Parameters:
        data - The DataSet to be written to the output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IO error occurs writing to the output.

      • write

        private void write(DataSet data,
                   Indent indent)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Performs the actual writing. This private method includes the indentation and is also called from write(lexa.core.data.DataItem, lexa.core.data.io.Indent).
        Parameters:
        data - The DataSet to be written to the output.
        indent - The Indent to prefix the output.

      • writeDataFile

        public static void writeDataFile(java.io.File file,
                                 DataSet data)
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Write an entire DataSet into a file.
        This provides a single line method call to open a data file, write all of a data set and close it cleanly.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be written
        data - the data to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file cannot be found
        java.io.IOException - when a problem is encountered writing to the file.
